title: ItemDelivery - Requester Module "BotLossPrevention" [update 2019-01-26 v31]
descriptionMarkdown:
**Module to request additional ConstructionBots**

Here you find a blueprint for a cluster of combinators that can be attached to a existing RequesterBase to add a certain behaviour. 
Those clusters are subsequently called "module". 

Explanation of the module is below. 


**A system to deliver items by train from a central base to outposts.** 


see also: [ItemDelivery - ProviderBase](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4ThUDlc3ebWiNTQHbv)

see also: [ItemDelivery - RequesterBase](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4Thzw_FogBACMitAlR)

see also: [ItemDelivery - TestSetup](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4Tj7Wzf3BhoIh_kFoE)

see also: [ItemDelivery - Requester Module "Inhibitor"](https://factorioprints.com/view/-LX9bQG1RsJzUXNQPRm3)

see also: [ItemDelivery - Requester Module "BotLossPrevention"](https://factorioprints.com/view/-LXA1qPbtXRp8KI8ZPxW)


--- 

- **usecase **
 - when building large roboport networks, parts can be disconnected due to discharge of roboports. 
 - it is possible to loose construction bots to a disconnected network or powerless roboports. 
 - this module requests additional construction bots if previous bots have been lost. 


---
- **usage**
 - module is blueprinted over existing RequesterBase
 - blueprint will fit to any existing RequesterBase
 - module will send a additional request if 
   - RequesterBase is enabled 
   - RequesterBase is at least at step 1 (Signal-S > 0)
   - it's own ID is reached (in the clocked counter)
   - the fourth step is not reached (Signal-S < 4)
   - less than 5 construction bots are in the network of the primary roboport (see below *1)
 - the bot request will be made even if the previously delivered items are not used up ("passive provider chests are not empty")
 - no additional configuration is required. The RequesterBase ID is read from the existing base. 



---
- **annotation** 
 - (*1) the primary roboport is the one that is built with the requesterbase 
 - for detecting the number of construction bots a roboport is read. 
   - therefore modded construcion bots are also included in the decision. 
 - when a train enters the Requesterbase the step (Signal-S) is incremented
   - if the module requests construction bots it decrements the Signal-S by one, so that no regular requests are skipped

---

- **compatibility**
 - RequesterBase v09 and above
 - ProviderBase v09 and above

--- 

- **changelog** 
 - 2019-01-26 v31
   - initial release
